Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian, probably black-figured, pottery neck-amphora with modelled ridge at junction with neck; glaze mostly fired red-brown; exterior: ridge glazed with possibly a trace of added red; band at top of shoulder and frieze of outlined tongues (alternating black, red and added white) with white dots between; below, upper part of myrtle wreath.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel regarding the wreath, see British Museum 1888,0208.104 from Tell Dafana.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 131, no. 15)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 87, pl. X, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.022) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
